storyInfo: Federico will prioritize any and all pending matters, and the arrest of Arturia, standing before his eyes, is far from his greatest priority right now.

attributes.content: All is prepared. Come Matins, the people will take... take their final communion.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Will your strings... lament for me? Or will they celebrate me?
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: I am clueless about music, Arturia. Just as I cannot understand you.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Here you stand, and here I empathize with you, yet you seem a total blank.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: I am no more than free to perform according to Your Excellency's will. My music is but a mirror.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: A mirror... hah.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: The elderly abbot lifts a porcelain tray, his hands quivering amidst string's overtones.
He appears as if wrestling with the sound that echoes throughout the dark, awaiting their end.
He was still young when the sounds of paradise arose in the abbey years and years ago, so young that his reflection in the fountain did not yet show a single hair of white.

Wild fowls were drawn to these roving soils, fluttering through skies rich with organ chords, flying for the square. In his old age, the last abbot handed the monastery down to him, Cleric Stefano, the youngest of them all.

attributes.text: 'You must be their keeper, that they live in Paradise.'
And how? How would I see them stay in Paradise?

attributes.content: Abbot Torregrossa shuts his eyes. Storied is his life.
The strings continue to echo, echo, echo. And thenâ€”
He lets his hands go.
How painful. So this is your choice.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: From behind the sealed chapel entrance comes the muffled sound of speech.
Federico stands in the spacious hall for a while, listening, then turns to walk upstairs.
...Equipment normal.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The only loss has been one communicator.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Current objective remains unchanged. Proceeding with mission.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Locked onto suspect.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: How're things in there?
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Communion should be over by now.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Is it as bad in there as I think?
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Signs point to yes.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Damn. How's Federico?
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Unreachable.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: The Church of the Deep doesn't breed pushovers for monsters. Does he know that?
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Someone needs to do the work. Status on Lemuen and Serpilia?
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: They got your message and went underground to investigate.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Alright. That means the trickiest job of all is all ours.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Let's open up.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: And be where we may, and face what we may, it remains that we must respect each other in kind, care for each other in kindâ€”
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: â€”Good morning, emissaries of the Holy City.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: The trays are empty.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Richele, get every inhabitant under control. I'll handle the abbot.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Is there something amiss, emissary?
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Amiss? Well, here's the thing... what's got you so down, Most Reverend Abbot? So insistent that Matins today has to be the 'final' one?
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: I'm pretty sure Lemuen's informed you that after you dock back up with Laterano, there's a real chance you'll continue serving as this monastery's abbot...
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Emissaries of Laterano, you question me... but on what basis?
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: I have made my choiceâ€”renounced my vain hopes that all could be met with equal salvation.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: The monastery's course is run. On this final Matins, may all our trays be empty.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: I have just delivered them the news. The Sanctilaminium Ambrosii has agreed to return to Laterano.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Return to Laterano...?
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Sir, don't tell me you thought we'd let the Church of the Deep off the hook...
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: ...I told you, my choice is made.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Oren, he's telling the truth.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: The inhabitants haven't shown any signs of change. I've examined the trays, and they're clean.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Yes. I prepared the flesh of those monsters by my own hand, and mixed it all into the bread.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: But though it was meant for Matins, I locked it away in a cabinet underground, lest my starving people ingest it accidentally.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Now that Aulus has left, that which you fear flourishes no longer.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: This is the key to the cabinet door. Take it, it is my plea. This will prove that what I say is true. Perhaps you will know better how handle the Church of the Deep's givings.
attributes.name: Abbot

attributes.content: Thank you for cooperating.
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Looks like my gun's resting easy today...
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: What, are you sad about that?
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: Come again?
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: No, I'm just breathing out, finally. We got the rough part over with. Work should be getting back on track now... right?
attributes.name: Richele

attributes.content: Lemuen, catch what the abbot said? I'm bringing the key down now.
attributes.name: Oren

attributes.content: You don't have to.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Someone smashed the cabinet open. It's empty inside.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Yellowing napkins, pottery shards all over the floor. All the details line up with the abbot's description.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: And looking at previous accounts, the consequences of eating this stuff are irreversible... If he'd made them partake already, he wouldn't need to lie to us anymore.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Which means someone's gone and thieved this little 'Eucharist.'
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: We have to find them immediately.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Uh, finding one person in an abbey this bigâ€”maybe a tall order?
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.content: It's hitting me. I think we've all forgotten a few things.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: For one, Gerald heard about how that Sankta girl fell, and that dealt him a huge shock.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: But we would've never let any word out about the falling. How did Gerald learn of it?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: And for another, just what was the deal with that fire in the sacrarium?
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: Without someone else's encouragement, the abbot might not have been so dogmatic either...
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: After all of this, I've got a bad feeling our abbot's not alone in his despair.
attributes.name: Lemuen

attributes.content: When Fortuna went into the chapel, I remember somebody else was in there.
attributes.name: Serpilia

attributes.text: So this is the Abbot's choice...
Not that it hasn't crossed my mind beforeâ€”that things would ultimately turn out this way.
He is kindhearted. So kindhearted that he strove to this day, embracing such lofty ideals, and in turn, he lost to weakness at the very last moment.
But I am not like him.
It was long, long ago that I gave up hope.

attributes.content: Oh? A guest.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I have to say, I'm a little surprised. I gave you fair warning, but...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I thought with all your rational, logical judgment, you'd conclude that 'there are other matters of higher priority to handle,' or something like that.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: How long has it been since we last met, Federico? Five, maybe close to six years?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Hm? Aren't you going to sayâ€”'Discontinue this meaningless speech, fugitive Arturia?'
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Or do you finally plan to switch to a different greeting?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Why not go back to those days when you lived with me, then... and call me Soror?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Oh...? And you're still not angry?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The first instant you came through the door and saw me, you didn't even make a move. That's unlike you.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Let me take a guess at why you're so out of sorts, then.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Are you waiting for something?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Or... are you hesitating?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Listen. Sounds of all kinds fill this little monastery.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Sorrow, pain, suspicion, resentment... and despair.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: All woven together. More exquisitely touching than any man-made melody could ever be.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Ah... how very curious. Federico Giallo, have you felt anything? Is there any note out there that can dance within your brain, the one so different to how normal people think?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Fugitive Arturia, I have fully assessed your words and actions.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: My present priority to address is not you.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You aren't in the chapel, Senior Federico?
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: I thought you and your colleagues all had your eyes fixed on the Most Reverend Abbot...
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: You are the prevailing suspect in this series of abnormalities.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I honor... yes, I honor His Excellency's choice.
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: We all respect him. Love him. This was always the way it would be, for we are all under His Excellency's wing...
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: It's simple to understand, isn't it?
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: When every cause sees you expelled from the cities, and your only choice is to roam the wastes, and you've become sure your end lies in death...
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: When your stomach groans with hunger, and all you ever find is despair, no matter where you walk, and eternity seems to have you trapped in the land that eats of man...
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: That's when past a gentle hill, and over the rock, you enter a canyon.
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: You see a building past the dust, a building that could dare to be a city, where its people bring you food, and let you stay in a room for the night.
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: Yes, there is only meager grit-like bread, and a bowl of watery soup.
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: Yes, there are cracks in the walls of the rooms, forever in need of repair...
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: But you have not died in the wastes. You have been admitted.
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: And that is why some of you call this place Paradise.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: 'Paradise'... yet it was a sham.
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: Not long after I arrived here, I found... that a Sarkaz friend of mine who'd caught Oripathy had vanished from my side.
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: I spent an age searching for her, only to find... she was here all along, in a room in the basement. They say it used to be a training room. Its walls are sturdier than all...
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: It's to that room where they send the deathly ill.
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: Improvised protective equipment cannot obstruct the propagation of Originium dust with any effectiveness.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: We didn't have any other way.
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: Maybe you want to tell me how the sick could decide in their own final moments to leave the monastery, and go out into the wastes alone to wait for death to take them?
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: We can only bury this pain out of sight, and cover our ears, and turn not to look... We could never save anybody, and there's no one who could save us.
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: But even this facade of serenity is waiting to be shattered in the end.
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: And here we are. You've come.
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: Our mission here is to maintain order.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Of course. It wasn't any of you that destroyed our life here, after all. It simply and naturally came to the way it is now, as a matter of course.
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: And no matter how carefully I tend to the flowers I plant, when it's time for them to wilt, they will transform in invisible measures until they're beyond recognition. It's all the same.
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: You have been affected by Arturia.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You mean by Seniora Arturia's music?
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: Perhaps. In them, I often hear recollections of these things.
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: But she's never been a part of our lives. I know, she simply takes our distress, our suffering, as ornaments for her leisure...
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: And so, how could she ever go far enough to disturb our wills, to make these choices for us?
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: ...Dangerous articles detected.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You have concealed a large quantity of flammables beneath this sacrariumâ€”noâ€”this entire monastery.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Yes.
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: It was a... possible alternative.
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: Whether you came or not, the tranquil life of this monastery was never going to last.
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: Have you seen what hunger and fear of wandering the barrens can drive people to, Senior Federico?
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: I have.
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: Before things reach the point of no redemption... I will end it all.
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: ClÃ©ment Dubois, you are a suspect in the destruction of the Sanctilaminium Ambrosii, and are involved in multiple cases that concern or have concerned the rights of Lateran citizens.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You have been confirmed an executorial target by the Notarial Hall. In accordance with regulation, I will immediately proceed to apprehend you.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Federico never gives more warning than needed. The gun in his hands simply serves the place of speech.
ClÃ©ment has not collapsed.
The wasting man clutches at his arm, where all feeling is lost, and gives a bitter smile.
Destruction of lighter confirmed.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Why... won't you kill me?
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: Why go to the bother of aiming for the lighter?
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: Your actions have not directly led to the deaths of any Lateran citizens. The law would not sentence you to death.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The law... So many years I've lived here, hearkening to His Excellency's guidance, following your law.
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: I feel its bind in ordinary times... Yet in chaos, in the time we need it most, it disappears without a trace.
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: There was some point where the music of Seniora Arturia became all I could even hear.
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment

attributes.content: Senior Federico, is it the law of Laterano that wants to save me... or is it you, yourself?
attributes.name: ClÃ©ment
